Outreach limit: engage 10 leads per day from each priority tier's search results to maintain manageable contact volume.

results.title: Retail Council of Canada
results.content:
Overview:
Retail Council of Canada (RCC) is a not-for-profit association representing small, mid, and large retail businesses in every community across the country. 𝗔𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗩𝗼𝗶𝗰𝗲 𝗼𝗳 𝗥𝗲𝘁𝗮𝗶𝗹™ 𝗶𝗻 𝗖𝗮𝗻𝗮𝗱𝗮, 𝘄𝗲 𝗽𝗿𝗼𝘂𝗱𝗹𝘆 𝗿𝗲𝗽𝗿𝗲𝘀𝗲𝗻𝘁 𝗺𝗼𝗿𝗲 𝘁𝗵𝗮𝗻 𝟱𝟰,𝟬𝟬𝟬 𝘀𝘁𝗼𝗿𝗲𝗳𝗿𝗼𝗻𝘁𝘀 𝗶𝗻 𝗮𝗹𝗹 𝗿𝗲𝘁𝗮𝗶𝗹 𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗺𝗮𝘁𝘀, 𝗶𝗻𝗰𝗹𝘂𝗱𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗱𝗲𝗽𝗮𝗿𝘁𝗺𝗲𝗻𝘁, 𝗴𝗿𝗼𝗰𝗲𝗿𝘆, 𝘀𝗽𝗲𝗰𝗶𝗮𝗹𝘁𝘆, 𝗱𝗶𝘀𝗰𝗼𝘂𝗻𝘁, 𝗶𝗻𝗱𝗲𝗽𝗲𝗻𝗱𝗲𝗻𝘁 𝗿𝗲𝘁𝗮𝗶𝗹𝗲𝗿𝘀, 𝗼𝗻𝗹𝗶𝗻𝗲 𝗺𝗲𝗿𝗰𝗵𝗮𝗻𝘁𝘀 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗾𝘂𝗶𝗰𝗸 𝘀𝗲𝗿𝘃𝗶𝗰𝗲 𝗿𝗲𝘀𝘁𝗮𝘂𝗿𝗮𝗻𝘁𝘀. RCC promotes and protects the retail industry through 𝗲𝗳𝗳𝗲𝗰𝘁𝗶𝘃𝗲 𝗮𝗱𝘃𝗼𝗰𝗮𝗰𝘆, 𝘁𝗵𝗼𝘂𝗴𝗵𝘁 𝗹𝗲𝗮𝗱𝗲𝗿𝘀𝗵𝗶𝗽 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗲𝗱𝘂𝗰𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻, including: 𝗡𝗲𝘁𝘄𝗼𝗿𝗸𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗲𝘃𝗲𝗻𝘁𝘀 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝗳𝗲𝗿𝗲𝗻𝗰𝗲𝘀 tailored to all aspects of the retail sector. results.title: Gary Hayes - Owner, Retail Adventure Inc.
results.content:
Gary Hayes
Owner, Retail Adventure Inc.
Pointe-Claire, Quebec, Canada
500 connections, 18052 followers


About
With a rich background in Canadian retailing, I have been at the forefront of innovative concepts that have left a lasting mark on the industry. One of my notable achievements was pioneering the BAYMART discount store concept at The Bay, long before the advent of Walmart in Canada. The success of BAYMART led to an expanded role, where I steered The Bay's foray into apparel, positioning it as a fashion leader in the 70's. Transitioning from department stores to specialty retail, I took on roles of increasing responsibility at Reitman's. As Vice President of Smart Set, and later as VP of Reitman's in the 80's, I introduced the groundbreaking in-season "item" repeat concept, a strategy that anticipated the "fast fashion" approach adopted by industry giants like Forever 21, H&M, and Zara. My journey then led me to Giant Tiger, where I devised and executed a robust fashion apparel strategy, fortifying GT against the challenges posed by Walmart. The events I orchestrated, including the PJ Party, Breast Cancer, Get Fit, Garden Party, and Canada Day celebrations, commanded a dominant presence in the market. I leverage my extensive experience in department stores, specialty retail, and discount stores to navigate the dynamic landscape of digital marketing. I know what has to be done on social media. My focus lies in evaluating retail strategies and uncovering emerging opportunities, all of which are meticulously documented in my weekly reports. THE REPORT: At the heart of my work is a weekly senior management report, meticulously crafted to unveil potential opportunities and highlight potential pitfalls. Armed with unfiltered information, this report empowers decision-makers to pose the right questions and allocate resources strategically to address the most pressing challenges.


Experience
Owner
[Retail Adventure Inc.](N/A)  
Jun 1999 - Present
Montreal, Quebec, Canada



Education
University of Oregon
Bachelor of Business Administration (B.B.A.), Marketing/Marketing Management, General
1959 - 1963
Activities and Societies: foreign students scholarship for academic excellence.

results.title: Zoran Kocovski - Founding Partner, Sassafraz Restaurant
results.content:
Zoran Kocovski
Founding Partner, Sassafraz Restaurant
Toronto, Ontario, Canada
500 connections, 724 followers


About
My roots run deep in the food world, and I wouldn’t want it any other way. I come from a Macedonian family entrenched in simple farming. When our family immigrated to Canada with few materials to our name, I was only an infant. My father took a position as a cook, and my mother as a factory worker, before they saved enough money to open a 50-seat diner in Toronto. The entrepreneurial spirit I witnessed in my dad had been in our family for generations. The value he put on an honest day’s work inspired me... It continues to motivate me today. With education being integral to my family, I went on to York University. Several business ventures later, I found myself back in the restaurant business with the launch of Sassafraz. When a devastating fire occurred there, it redefined my career as I came away with a new sense of the vital importance of community and a passion for creating positive change.


Experience
Principal
[Sassafraz Restaurant](https://ca.linkedin.com/company/sassafraz)  
Jul 1997 - Present
100 Cumberland Street

York University
BA, Psychology
1982 - 1987

results.title: Dan Holman - Business Owner | Speaker | Implementer
results.content:
Dan Holman
Business Owner | Speaker | Implementer | Retail Mentor | Consultant I Trainer
St Albert, Alberta, Canada
500 connections, 1600 followers


About
Dan has spent more than 30 years in the retail and service industries. Specializing in marketing & business development, inventory planning, operations and customer driven sales management. He is an award-winning business coach with a proven understanding of what it takes to be successful as an entrepreneur. Dan spent 16 years in senior management and ownership roles with multi-store retailers before joining Canadian Retail Solutions as their CEO, Director of Retail Planning. Dan works directly with clients’ coast to coast representing hundreds of retail categories. He is the founder of The Wealthy Retailer™ which began as an educational series delivering a successive in-depth look at key areas for growing and nurturing retail stores to maximize their profit potential.


Experience
CEO, Director of Retail Planning
[Canadian Retail Solutions Inc.](https://ca.linkedin.com/company/canadian-retail-solutions-inc.)  
Apr 2016 - Present
Canada

Toys, comics, books, collectables cards, stuffed animals, you name it, I’ve made it and ultimately sold it. Self-made, self-taught, and an entrepreneurial spirit that I’ve let run wild since the age of 14, has left me with a lifetime of lessons and memories. I certainly took the road less travelled, my own path has lead me to the unique position of owning multiple companies in the toy, licensing and publishing sectors. While each company is different in their own right, I believe that leadership starts at the top and I make it a point of emphasis to tailor the corporate culture to the type of team I’m building to help bring my visions to life.

results.raw_content:
# Why Canadian design matters: a founder's perspective

This title was summarized by AI from the post below.

[Laurie Baker, PhD](https://ca.linkedin.com/in/lauriembaker?trk=public_post_feed-actor-name)

Founder of Origyn - Plant-based leather accessories & Executive Director - Treefrog Accelerator

* [Report this post](/uas/login?session_redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.linkedin.com%2Fposts%2Flauriembaker_canadaday-origyn-simons-activity-7345812599034343424-uUS5&trk=public_post_ellipsis-menu-semaphore-sign-in-redirect&guestReportContentType=POST&_f=guest-reporting)

As a founder building a Canadian brand from the ground up, I think a lot about the systems that make or break independent businesses. Canadian fashion isnt just about what we makeits about who makes space for it. The reality is: if youre producing ethically, using innovative, next-gen materials, and refusing to cut corners, the margins are challenging. You need retail partners who get it. Who believe in more than volume. Who are willing to take risks on ideas that dont always look scalable at first glance. I respect what [La Maison Simons](https://ca.linkedin.com/company/maisonsimons?trk=public_post-text) has built. Theyve managed to grow without abandoning the ecosystem they came from. Theyve supported Canadian design in real, tangible waysand thats rare. If we want a future where brands like [Origyn](https://ca.linkedin.com/company/origyn-apparel?trk=public_post-text) can thrive, we need more retailers who treat Canadian design as cultural infrastructure, not just product. Grateful to everyone building that future. [#CanadaDay](https://www.linkedin.com/signup/cold-join?session_redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.linkedin.com%2Ffeed%2Fhashtag%2Fcanadaday&trk=public_post-text) [#Origyn](https://www.linkedin.com/signup/cold-join?session_redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.linkedin.com%2Ffeed%2Fhashtag%2Forigyn&trk=public_post-text) [#Simons](https://www.linkedin.com/signup/cold-join?session_redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.linkedin.com%2Ffeed%2Fhashtag%2Fsimons&trk=public_post-text) [#SupportLocalBusiness](https://www.linkedin.com/signup/cold-join?session_redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.linkedin.com%2Ffeed%2Fhashtag%2Fsupportlocalbusiness&trk=public_post-text) [#EthicalFashion](https://www.linkedin.com/signup/cold-join?session_redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.linkedin.com%2Ffeed%2Fhashtag%2Fethicalfashion&trk=public_post-text) [#RetailWithPurpose](https://www.linkedin.com/signup/cold-join?session_redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.linkedin.com%2Ffeed%2Fhashtag%2Fretailwithpurpose&trk=public_post-text) [#WomenInBusiness](https://www.linkedin.com/signup/cold-join?session_redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.linkedin.com%2Ffeed%2Fhashtag%2Fwomeninbusiness&trk=public_post-text)

[Origyn](https://ca.linkedin.com/company/origyn-apparel?trk=public_post_reshare_feed-actor-name)

38 followers

Canada Day is a good time to talk about some of the infrastructure that actually supports Canadian business. If you're building a values-driven brand in Canadaespecially in fashionyou know the odds are long. Production is expensive. Supply chains are fragile. And most major retail channels are either closing (Hudsons Bay) or owned elsewhere. Thats why local retailers like [La Maison Simons](https://ca.linkedin.com/company/maisonsimons?trk=public_post_reshare-text) matter. Theyre one of the few nationally recognized retail companies: - still family-owned - still headquartered in Canada - still investing in Canadian design and independent makers At Origyn, were creating ethically sourced, small-batch handbags that dont fit easily into mass retail. What we need isnt just shelf spacewe need alignment. We need retail partners who understand the value of slow production, regional materials, and long-term thinking. [La Maison Simons](https://ca.linkedin.com/company/maisonsimons?trk=public_post_reshare-text) has shown its possible to scale without losing sight of local. As Canadian brands try to build a different kind of futureSimons is a rare example of retail taking the long view. [#CanadaDay](https://www.linkedin.com/signup/cold-join?session_redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.linkedin.com%2Ffeed%2Fhashtag%2Fcanadaday&trk=public_post_reshare-text) [#CanadianRetail](https://www.linkedin.com/signup/cold-join?session_redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.linkedin.com%2Ffeed%2Fhashtag%2Fcanadianretail&trk=public_post_reshare-text) [#Origyn](https://www.linkedin.com/signup/cold-join?session_redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.linkedin.com%2Ffeed%2Fhashtag%2Forigyn&trk=public_post_reshare-text) [#Simons](https://www.linkedin.com/signup/cold-join?session_redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.linkedin.com%2Ffeed%2Fhashtag%2Fsimons&trk=public_post_reshare-text) [#SupportLocal](https://www.linkedin.com/signup/cold-join?session_redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.linkedin.com%2Ffeed%2Fhashtag%2Fsupportlocal&trk=public_post_reshare-text)

[27](https://www.linkedin.com/signup/cold-join?session_redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fwww%2Elinkedin%2Ecom%2Fposts%2Flauriembaker_canadaday-origyn-simons-activity-7345812599034343424-uUS5&trk=public_post_social-actions-reactions)

# Restaurants Canada
The voice of foodservice | La voix des services alimentaires
Non-profit Organizations • Toronto, Ontario • 37,784 followers • 11-50 employees

## Overview
Restaurants Canada is a national, not-for-profit member-based trade association advancing the potential of Canada’s diverse and dynamic foodservice industry through member programs, research, advocacy, resources and events. Canada’s foodservice sector is a $100 billion industry that serves 22 million customers across the country every day. As the fourth-largest private-sector employer, Canadian foodservice directly employs 1.2 million people and indirectly supports another 290,000+ jobs in related industries, with $32 billion in food and beverage products purchased every year. www.restaurantscanada.org

## Posts
**Restaurants Canada** (1d): Yesterday we had the pleasure of enjoying a delicious Osmow’s staff lunch—an extended celebration to congratulate the team on the re-opening of their original Streetsville location, the very spot where the Osmow's journey began over 20 years ago. Cheers to many more years of success! 🎉 👏 [Likes: 26, Comments: 0]; **Restaurants Canada** (2d): Generations may differ, but they all matter. 51% of Millennials dine out weekly, compared to 35% of Boomers. Gen X spends the most at restaurants, and Gen Z is reshaping discovery through social media. Learn more and stay ahead — Start reading the 2025 Foodservice Facts report here: https://bit.ly/4nOzY0U #FoodserviceFacts2025 #Foodservice #Hospitality #data #consumertrends [Likes: 29, Comments: 0]; **Recipe Unlimited Corporation** (3d 4d Edited): We’re proud to share that our CEO, Frank Hennessey, has been honoured with a Lifetime Achievement Award at this year’s Rotman Alumni Awards. This recognition celebrates Frank’s remarkable leadership, vision, and impact on the Canadian restaurant industry and beyond. Throughout his career, Frank has not only guided Recipe through growth and transformation but has also inspired those around him with his commitment to people, innovation, and community. Congratulations, Frank, on this well-deserved honour! [Likes: 42, Comments: 0]; **Foodservice and Hospitality magazine** (3d): Mark von Schellwitz , Restaurants Canada ’s VP of Western Canada, has announced his retirement after more than 28 years with the organization. https://lnkd.in/gX9zey_F [Likes: 105, Comments: 85]; **Restaurants Canada** (3d): In this episode, we sit down with Chris Elliott , Chief Economist & Vice President, Research at Restaurants Canada, to unpack some of the biggest surprises from 2025: to explore the surprising 2025 sales rebound, how the GST holiday gave operators more than a breather, and why domestic tourism was the quiet hero keeping restaurants busy. Chris takes us behind the numbers—like why alcohol sales are slipping, why solo dining is on the rise, and how his POST strategy (Pricing, Operations, Staffing, Technology) can help operators tackle rising costs head-on. We also dig into the hot topics shaping menus and margins plus the real power of using data to make smarter moves. Most importantly, Chris shares why Foodservice Facts should be every operator’s secret weapon and gives us a peek into what’s ahead in 2026. Listen for: • Why sales are up—but profits aren’t • The hidden cost of ignoring productivity • What’s really changing on Canadian menus • How operators can use data to stay competitive 🎧 Tune in now on Spotify: https://bit.ly/42Yr9JV #MENUUnplugged #podcast #FoodserviceFacts #restaurants #data _____________________ 🎙️MENU Unplugged Podcast is a co-production of Restaurants Canada & Benchmark Sixty Restaurant Services 🎙️This episode sponsored by Groupex Canada [Likes: 4, Comments: 0]; **Restaurants Canada** (4d): Restaurants Canada's 2025 Foodservice Facts report found that 8 in 10 young Canadians have cut back on restaurant spending because of rising living costs. Western Canada VP, Mark von Schellwitz joined CTV Vancouver to talk about what government can do to help Canadians struggling with affordability. Watch the full interview here: https://bit.ly/46KcCCC [Likes: 12, Comments: 0]; **Restaurants Canada** (5d): It was a big week back in Ottawa for Restaurants Canada as we continued our conversations and lobby work around immigration, temporary foreign workers, removing GST from all food and strengthening the viability of the foodservice sector during this period of economic uncertainty. Our message is gaining traction—conversations with key decision-makers confirm they’re listening to our advocacy on affordability, workforce, and related issues. The response to our FOODISFOOD.CA campaign was very positive and gaining more interest. Additionally, we were able to share important context, real data and information on the use of temporary foreign workers. While this remains a complex issue for our sector, it’s essential we use these programs responsibly and continue to uphold the industry’s integrity and reputation. Read President & CEO, KELLY HIGGINSON 's full update here: https://bit.ly/42JsBje [Likes: 15, Comments: 1]; **Restaurants Canada** (1w): 🌍✈️Happy World Tourism Day! This year's theme, "Tourism and Sustainable Transformation," is a call to action for all of us. From coast to coast to coast, tourism is a powerful force that drives our economy, industry, celebrates our culture, and connects us with the world. Our vibrant food scene plays a massive role in this! Every time you dine at a local restaurant, you're not just enjoying a meal, you're supporting a network of local producers, farmers, fishers, and chefs. You're helping to sustain jobs and preserve the unique culinary traditions that define our diverse communities. 💡Fun Fact: The restaurant industry accounts for approximately one third of all tourism-related jobs—making it the largest employer within the tourism sector. #WorldTourismDay #SustainableTourism #ExploreCanada #SupportLocal [Likes: 11, Comments: 0]; **Restaurants Canada** (1w): Restaurants Canada is deeply concerned about the nationwide strike launched by the Canadian Union of Postal Workers as Canadians and businesses cannot afford continued disruption. Read our full statement here: https://bit.ly/4myFELp [Likes: 4, Comments: 0]; **Restaurants Canada** (1w): The Temporary Foreign Worker Program represents just 3% of the foodservice workforce, but it fills a critical need for rural, remote and tourism communities. Restaurants Canada's KELLY HIGGINSON joined CBC's Ontario Today to discuss the reality of the foodservice industry's workforce needs. Listen to the full episode here: https://bit.ly/46pSTJQ [Likes: 11, Comments: 1]

results.title: Michèle Boudria - Former President & CEO, McDonald's ...
results.content:
Michèle Boudria
Former President & CEO, McDonald’s Canada
Canada
500 connections, 8117 followers


About
As President and CEO of McDonald’s Canada, Michèle led an iconic brand that serves millions of Canadians every year. Her first McDonald’s restaurant job at 16 in Aylmer, Quebec, led her through progressive roles across Canada, the US and Europe, bringing unparalleled operational experience to drive growth and profitability. She recently retired to focus on board and community work. Over the course of her 40+ year career, she learned every aspect of one of the world’s great businesses, including frontline service, training, operations, change management, competitive strategy, and executive leadership. At the apex of her career, she oversaw more than 1,400 franchised and corporate restaurants, generating billions of dollars in annual sales. Under her leadership, McDonald’s Canada achieved systemwide sales growth of nearly 20%, improved operational efficiency, and expanded digital and delivery channels to reach [millions] more customers. She championed a focus on delivering on the customer experience and making franchisees successful – all while maintaining the brand consistency and trust that defines McDonald’s.

results.content: Retail Council of Canada is instantly ‘back on the court’ with the appointment of Kim Furlong as President and CEO. 𝗞𝗶𝗺 𝗙𝘂𝗿𝗹𝗼𝗻𝗴 𝗔𝗽𝗽𝗼𝗶𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗱 𝗡𝗲𝘄 𝗣𝗿𝗲𝘀𝗶𝗱𝗲𝗻𝘁 & 𝗖𝗘𝗢 𝗼𝗳 𝗥𝗲𝘁𝗮𝗶𝗹 𝗖𝗼𝘂𝗻𝗰𝗶𝗹 𝗼𝗳 𝗖𝗮𝗻𝗮𝗱𝗮 RCC's Board of Directors is pleased to announce the appointment of Kim Furlong as the new President & Chief Executive Officer, effective September 2, 2025. Currently serving as CEO of the Canadian Venture Capital & Private Equity Association (CVCA), Kim has established herself as a powerful advocate for Canada's private capital sector, successfully influencing public policy and shaping the national investment landscape. Brisebois will continue to serve as President & CEO of Retail Council of Canada until Kim joins RCC in September. Kim Furlong Appointed New President & CEO of Retail Council of Canada   https://www.retailcouncil.org Congratulations Kim, and RCC. Wonderful news Kim Furlong! Congratulations Kim!

𝗞𝗶𝗺 𝗙𝘂𝗿𝗹𝗼𝗻𝗴 𝗔𝗽𝗽𝗼𝗶𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗱 𝗡𝗲𝘄 𝗣𝗿𝗲𝘀𝗶𝗱𝗲𝗻𝘁 & 𝗖𝗘𝗢 𝗼𝗳 𝗥𝗲𝘁𝗮𝗶𝗹 𝗖𝗼𝘂𝗻𝗰𝗶𝗹 𝗼𝗳 𝗖𝗮𝗻𝗮𝗱𝗮 RCC's Board of Directors is pleased to announce the appointment of [Kim Furlong](https://ca.linkedin.com/in/kimfurlong?trk=public_post_reshare-text) as the new President & Chief Executive Officer, effective September 2, 2025. Kim joins RCC with a distinguished career that spans over two decades at the intersection of government, industry, and advocacy—making her uniquely equipped to lead our organization into its next phase of growth. Currently serving as CEO of the Canadian Venture Capital & Private Equity Association (CVCA), Kim has established herself as a powerful advocate for Canada's private capital sector, successfully influencing public policy and shaping the national investment landscape. [Diane J. Brisebois](https://ca.linkedin.com/in/diane-j-brisebois-87629412?trk=public_post_reshare-text) will continue to serve as President & CEO of Retail Council of Canada until Kim joins RCC in September. results.title: Melissa Campisi - Vice President, Retail National Marketing
results.content:
Melissa Campisi
Vice President, Retail National Marketing
Toronto, Ontario, Canada
500 connections, 1659 followers


About
Melissa Campisi is a visionary leader and marketing strategist with a proven track record of transforming retail destinations through innovative, results-driven initiatives. With a natural ability to weave storytelling and creative placemaking into dynamic marketing strategies, she excels at increasing market share and building loyal audiences, which ultimately drive tenant and landlord revenues. As a thought leader in the marketing space, Melissa continues to shape and advance the industry by inspiring her peers, creating powerful moments, and connecting customers with properties across Canada. Over the course of her career, she has spearheaded some of Toronto’s most iconic events- most notably Toronto Fashion Week- blending placemaking with marketing to create vibrant, engaging environments that resonate with both audiences and stakeholders. Her diverse background spans multiple industries, including film and television, music, and philanthropy, allowing her to bring a unique perspective and outside-the-box thinking to the retail and real estate industry. Melissa is known for crafting compelling brand narratives and orchestrating multi-channel campaigns that foster customer loyalty and create unforgettable brand experiences. A dedicated philanthropist, Melissa actively supports several Toronto-based charities, including CANFAR, Sinai Health Foundation, and the National Ballet of Canada.


Experience
Vice President, Retail National Marketing
[QuadReal Property Group](https://ca.linkedin.com/company/quadreal)  
Jan 2024 - Present
N/A



Education
Western University
MIT
N/A - Present
None

results.raw_content:
### Retail General Manager

[Staples Canada](https://ca.linkedin.com/company/staples-canada?trk=public_jobs_sub-nav-cta-optional-url "Staples Canada") Newmarket, Ontario, Canada

# Retail General Manager

#### [Staples Canada](https://ca.linkedin.com/company/staples-canada?trk=public_jobs_topcard-org-name) Newmarket, Ontario, Canada 1 month ago 90 applicants [See who Staples Canada has hired for this role](https://www.linkedin.com/login?session_redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fwww%2Elinkedin%2Ecom%2Fsearch%2Fresults%2Fpeople%2F%3FfacetCurrentCompany%3D3020%26title%3DRetail%2BGeneral%2BManager&emailAddress=&fromSignIn=&trk=public_jobs_see-who-was-hired_people-search-link_face-pile-cta)

* [Report this job](https://www.linkedin.com/uas/login?fromSignIn=true&session_redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fca.linkedin.com%2Fjobs%2Fview%2Fretail-general-manager-at-staples-canada-4289942774&trk=public_jobs_ellipsis-menu-semaphore-sign-in-redirect&guestReportContentType=JOB&_f=guest-reporting)

**Job Description****Some of what you will do**We are seeking a dynamic and strategic General Manager to lead our retail operations team and drive operational excellence. As a General Manager, you will champion our selling model, inspire a customer-first mentality, and foster a culture of continuous improvement. Your leadership will be pivotal in achieving business and financial results, developing talent, and enhancing customer experiences.**Specifically, you will**

* Drive Operational and Sales Excellence: Model and nurture our sales culture to add value for our customers. Oversee all aspects of Brand Standards and implement continuous improvement initiatives.
* Leadership: Lead by example and with purpose, motivate and empower your team, and inspire exceptional customer service. Execute day-to-day floor leadership duties, making confident and purposeful decisions.
* Strategic Vision: Develop and execute a strategic vision to promote a customer-first mentality within the team. Inspire and work through your entire store team to bring this vision to life.
* Financial Management: Achieve business and financial targets by monitoring budgets, analyzing reports, and making informed decisions.
* Business Development: Identify and pursue business development opportunities, partner with customers for B2B solutions, and drive sales conversion.
* People Management: Manage scheduling, coach and develop talent, recruit top talent, and nurture employee engagement. Create an environment in which you and your team focus on development as a priority.
* Communication: Disseminate business communications, initiatives, and results. Act as a change leader and ensure transparency.
* Health & Safety: Ensure compliance for all aspects of Health & Safety, Asset Protection (AP), Privacy, and company policies and procedures.

**Some Of What You Need**

* 3-5 years of experience in a retail management role. Preferably as a General Manager.
* Proven experience with achieving sales and service targets with a customer-centered approach.
* Ability to lead in a fast-paced environment with strong prioritization, organization, and multi-tasking skills.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, people are inspired by your communication.
* Experience in coaching, developing talent, and managing teams.

**Some Of What You Will Get**

* Associate discount
* Health and dental benefits
* Competitive PTO; Personal Days
* RRSP/DPSP program
* Performance bonus
* Learning & Development programs
* And more...

#WorkLearnGrow1**About Us**Staples Canada is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion and we encourage applications from all qualified candidates, including those with disabilities.**About The Team****About the Team**At Staples Canada we are dynamic, inspiring partners to our customers and the communities in which we live. As The Working and Learning Company, we inspire people to work smarter, learn more and grow every day. We’re looking for curious, approachable, and passionate individuals who love finding solutions. If that’s you, let’s work, learn, and grow together.**We are building an inclusive and diverse team**Staples Canada is continuously working towards creating an inclusive and diverse work environment. We welcome, value and thrive on perspectives and contributions from backgrounds that vary by race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, lifestyle, age, educational background, national origin, religion or physical ability. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

* ### Seniority level

   Mid-Senior level
* ### Employment type

   Full-time
* ### Job function

   Sales and Business Development
* ### Industries

   Retail

results.title: Gary Hayes - Owner, Retail Adventure Inc.
results.content:
Gary Hayes
Owner, Retail Adventure Inc.
Pointe-Claire, Quebec, Canada
500 connections, 18052 followers


About
With a rich background in Canadian retailing, I have been at the forefront of innovative concepts that have left a lasting mark on the industry. One of my notable achievements was pioneering the BAYMART discount store concept at The Bay, long before the advent of Walmart in Canada. The success of BAYMART led to an expanded role, where I steered The Bay's foray into apparel, positioning it as a fashion leader in the 70's. Transitioning from department stores to specialty retail, I took on roles of increasing responsibility at Reitman's. As Vice President of Smart Set, and later as VP of Reitman's in the 80's, I introduced the groundbreaking in-season "item" repeat concept, a strategy that anticipated the "fast fashion" approach adopted by industry giants like Forever 21, H&M, and Zara. My journey then led me to Giant Tiger, where I devised and executed a robust fashion apparel strategy, fortifying GT against the challenges posed by Walmart. The events I orchestrated, including the PJ Party, Breast Cancer, Get Fit, Garden Party, and Canada Day celebrations, commanded a dominant presence in the market. I leverage my extensive experience in department stores, specialty retail, and discount stores to navigate the dynamic landscape of digital marketing. I know what has to be done on social media. My focus lies in evaluating retail strategies and uncovering emerging opportunities, all of which are meticulously documented in my weekly reports. THE REPORT: At the heart of my work is a weekly senior management report, meticulously crafted to unveil potential opportunities and highlight potential pitfalls. Armed with unfiltered information, this report empowers decision-makers to pose the right questions and allocate resources strategically to address the most pressing challenges.


Experience
Owner
[Retail Adventure Inc.](N/A)  
Jun 1999 - Present
Montreal, Quebec, Canada



Education
University of Oregon
Bachelor of Business Administration (B.B.A.), Marketing/Marketing Management, General
1959 - 1963
Activities and Societies: foreign students scholarship for academic excellence.

Cary Brandes
🤓 Founder of RenegadeRetailer & Cie. 🎙 Founder of ThatCouldBeAPodcast.com (Stay Tuned). 👍 Mental Health Advocate.
Canada
500 connections, 21463 followers


About
I'm a Content Creator, Retail Consultant and Mental Health Advocate who is passionate about sharing life experiences to inspire others. As the founder of RenegadeRetailer, I help businesses navigate the ever evolving Retail landscape, while through RenegadeBigBrain, I openly champion Mental Health advocacy, embracing the gift of being Bipolar. 💡 Retail & Leadership. With a wealth of progressive Leadership and Management experience across North America, I take pride in fostering growth, driving impactful results, and mentoring teams to succeed. 🧠 Mental Health & Authenticity. Believing in the power of storytelling, I use my own journey both in retail leadership and Mental Health to empower others, give a voice to those who feel unheard, and encourage authenticity in all aspects of life. If you're curious to learn more, explore my portfolio and connect with me here: www.linktr.ee/CaryBrandes And as always, Stay Phenomenal 🤩 _______________________________________________________________________ Je suis créateur de contenu, consultant en commerce de détail et militant pour la santé mentale, animé par le désir de partager mes expériences de vie afin d’inspirer les autres. En tant que fondateur de RenegadeRetailer, j’aide les entreprises à naviguer dans un paysage du commerce de détail en constante évolution, tandis qu’avec RenegadeBigBrain, je défends activement la santé mentale en embrassant le cadeau d’être Bipolaire. 💡 Commerce de détail & leadership. Fort d’une expérience progressive en gestion et en leadership à travers l’Amérique du Nord, je suis fier de favoriser la croissance, d’obtenir des résultats significatifs et de guider les équipes vers le succès. 🧠 Santé mentale & authenticité. Convaincu du pouvoir du récit, je partage mon parcour tant dans le leadership en commerce de détail que dans la santé mentale pour inspirer, donner une voix à ceux qui se sentent ignorés et encourager l’authenticité sous toutes ses formes. Si vous souhaitez en savoir plus, explorez mon portfolio et contactez-moi ici : www.linktr.ee/CaryBrandes Et comme toujours, Soyez phénoménal 🤩.

N/A  


### Entrepreneur  
[Other](N/A)  
Dec 1999 - Present   
N/A  
Toys, comics, books, collectables cards, stuffed animals, you name it, I’ve made it and ultimately sold it. Self-made, self-taught, and an entrepreneurial spirit that I’ve let run wild since the age of 14, has left me with a lifetime of lessons and memories. I certainly took the road less travelled, my own path has lead me to the unique position of owning multiple companies in the toy, licensing and publishing sectors. While each company is different in their own right, I believe that leadership starts at the top and I make it a point of emphasis to tailor the corporate culture to the type of team I’m building to help bring my visions to life.
